perturbation.original_text: 1.2 It is the goal of the Seller Trusts to have all of the Shares sold, on a pro-rata basis, in three or more tranches (each a "Tranche") commencing not earlier than six (6) months after the Effective Date with the resale of all of the shares of Stock completed as soon as practicable after the Effective Date.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2 It is the goal of the Seller Trusts to have all of the Shares sold, on a pro-rata basis, in three or more tranches (each a "Tranche") commencing at any time after the Effective Date with the resale of all of the shares of Stock completed within five years after the Effective Date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that sales should commence no earlier than six months after the effective date and be completed as soon as practicable. The modified text contradicts this by saying sales can commence at any time after the effective date and be completed within five years. This creates a contradiction regarding the timing and duration of the sales, making enforcement uncertain.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Term; Termination; Withdrawal of Bank. (a) This OMA shall expire upon the earlier of (i) the first anniversary of the Effective Date and (ii) the date that all Shares of Stock of the Seller Trusts as set forth on Schedule A hereto have been sold (the "Term").
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 Term; Termination; Withdrawal of Bank. (a) This OMA shall expire upon the earlier of (i) the second anniversary of the Effective Date and (ii) the date that 75% of Shares of Stock of the Seller Trusts as set forth on Schedule A hereto have been sold (the "Term").
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies the OMA expires on the first anniversary or when all shares are sold. The modified text contradicts this by changing the expiration date to the second anniversary and reducing the share sale threshold to 75%. This introduces ambiguity regarding the agreement's term and the required share sale percentage.

perturbation.original_text: 4.3 Notices. All notices and other communications among the Parties shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given (i) when delivered in person, (ii) when delivered after posting in the United States mail having been sent registered or certified mail return receipt requested, postage prepaid, (iii) when delivered by FedEx or other nationally recognized overnight delivery service or (iv) when received by facsimile or email (provided that a copy is subsequently delivered by one of the other methods permitted in (i) through (iii) of this Section 4.3), addressed as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: 4.3 Notices. All notices and other communications among the Parties shall be deemed to have been duly given (i) only when delivered in person, (ii) only when delivered after posting in the United States mail having been sent registered mail return receipt requested, postage prepaid, (iii) when delivered by FedEx or other nationally recognized overnight delivery service or (iv) when received by facsimile or email.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows for notices to be considered duly given via multiple methods but specifies that if facsimile or email is used, a copy must be subsequently delivered via another permitted method. The modified text removes the clause "provided that a copy is subsequently delivered by one of the other methods permitted in (i) through (iii) of this Section 4.3)". This makes it uncertain which communication methods are acceptable on their own, thus creating a contradiction on the original text.
